title: How to stream UEFA Women EURO quarterfinal free today : Watch Sweden vs . England
body_text:
The quarterfinals of the UEFA Women’s European Championship continue on Thursday, July 17 at Stadion Letzigrund in Zürich where England will take on Sweden.
This soccer match is scheduled to start at 3 p.m. EDT and will be broadcast on FOX. Fans looking to watch this match can do so for free by using DIRECTV, which offers a free trial, or FuboTV, which also offers a free trial as well as up to $25 off your first month. SlingTV doesn’t offer a free trial but has promotional offers available for streaming the match.
The winner of this match will take on Italy in the semifinals on Tuesday, July 22.
Outside of England’s tournament opener, a 2-1 loss to France, these squads are a combined 5-0 in their other matches. England finished second in Group D because of that loss, but had a higher goal differential than France thanks to a 4-0 win over the Netherlands and a 6-1 result in their Group Stage finale against Wale.
Sweden had its offense improve match-by-match, first getting a 1-0 victory over Denmark in Matchday 1. That was followed with a 3-0 victory against Poland that secured a spot in the Knockout Stage along with Germany. Those two matched up in Matchday 3 and Sweden toppled Germany 4-1.
Who: Sweden vs. England
When: Thursday, July 17 at 3 p.m. EDT
Where: Stadion Letzigrund in Zürich
Stream: DIRECTV (free trial); FuboTV (free trial); SlingTV
Betting: Check out our MA sports betting guide, where you can learn basic terminology, definitions and how to read odds for those interested in learning how to bet in Massachusetts.
What is DIRECTV?
DIRECTV is an internet TV service that offers your favorite entertainment, news and sports channels, as well as local TV stations and regional sports networks. Sign up now and get three free months of premium channels including MAX, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME and Starz.
What is FuboTV?
FuboTV is an internet television service that offers more than 200 channels across sports and entertainment including Paramount+ with SHOWTIME. From the UEFA Champions League to the WNBA to international tournaments ranging across sports, there’s plenty of options available on FuboTV, which offers a free trial and up to $25 off the first month for new customers.
What is Sling TV?
Sling TV offers a variety of live programming ranging from news and sports and starting as low as $20 a month for your first month. Subscribers also get a month of DVR Plus free if they sign up now. Choose from a variety of sports packages without long-term contracts and with easy cancellation.
